Graduate RF Coursework

May 4, 2019 » graduate-work

I completed 30 credits of graduate-level radio frequency engineering coursework at the University of Colorado Boulder to earn my Masterâ€™s Degree including:

  • Waveguides and Transmission Lines
  • Computational Electromagnetics
  • Passive RF Design
  • Active RF Design
  • MMIC Design

Here are some of the final reports and projects from my coursework.

Design of a 5 GHz Harmonic Injection Power Amplifier for Linearity and Efficiency

Designed in Keysight ADS.

Study of Mutual Coupling in Array Antennas

Completed with HFSS Simulation, validated with FEKO, and additional post-processing of data with MATLAB.

A 5-GHz 5.8-W Class-A GaN MMIC Power Amplifier

Designed with NI AWR Microwave Office using the TriQuint 0.25um GaN 3MI Design Process.

Independent Study in MMIC Design

Designed in Qorvo GaAs process QP25GEN2.

Fundamentals of RF Measurements
